alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 8:23PM EDT until August 05 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Chesterfield. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM EDT, Heavy rain has fallen from thunderstorms over the past few hours. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Little additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, Chester, Chesterfield Court House, Bensley, Bellwood, Midlothian, Drewrys Bluff and Centralia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
